newsitem.title: GERMANY: SOCCER-DORTMUND'S CESAR TO MISS EUROPEAN SEMIFINAL.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-DORTMUND'S CESAR TO MISS EUROPEAN SEMIFINAL.

text.p: Borussia Dortmund have given up hope of Brazilian international Julio Cesar returning to their defence for Wednesday's European Cup semifinal first leg against Manchester United.
The German champions, whose defence has already been hit by the suspension of international libero Matthias Sammer, said on Sunday that Cesar had yet to recover from a knee injury.
But coach Ottmar Hitzfeld said he hoped strikers Karlheinz Riedle, who has a groin injury, and Heiko Herrlich, who has hurt his shoulder, would be fit to return to the squad for the tie in Dortmund.
A decision about Riedle will be made after training on Tuesday while Herrlich is expected to start the match on the bench.
Hitzfeld's biggest problem concerns Sammer's replacement as libero. German international Stefan Reuter, normally the right wing-back, and Austrian Wolfgang Feiersinger are the two candidates.
